inference:
Let the length of the rectangle be $x$.

The width of the rectangle is $x-2$.

The perimeter of the rectangle is $56$.

Therefore, \begin{align*}
2(x+(x-2))&=56\\
2(2x-2)&=56\\
4x-4&=56\\
4x&=60\\
x&=15
\end{align*}

Therefore, the length of the rectangle is $15$ and the width of the rectangle is $15-2=13$.

The area of the rectangle is $15\times13=\boxed{195}$.

Final Answer: $\boxed{195}$. I hope it is correct.
ground_truth:
Since the perimeter of the rectangle is 56, then \begin{align*}
2(x+2)+2(x-2)&=56\\
2x+4+2x-4&=56\\
4x& = 56 \\
x & = 14
\end{align*}Therefore the rectangle has area \[(14-2)(14+2)=14^2-2^2=196-4=\boxed{192}.\]
